Event.0: The U.S. Congress passed a bill, by a wide margin, granting U.S. President George W. Bush broad authority to use force against Iraq.
Event.1: In a ceremony in London, the International Women of the Year Association awarded the title Greatest Woman Achiever of the Century to Russian cosmonaut Valentina V. Tereshkova, the first woman in space.
Event.2: South African Cricket Board issues former captain Hansie Cronje with a life ban as a result of match-fixing allegations
Event.3: Ronald Reagan and Mikhail Gorbachev open talks at a summit in Reykjavik, Iceland
Event.4: "Can't Slow Down" 2nd studio album by Lionel Richie is released
Event.5: The TV sketch comedy and variety show Saturday Night Live debuted on NBC and became a landmark in American television.
Event.6: "Saturday Night Live" created by Lorne Michaels premieres on NBC with George Carlin as host
Event.7: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) was established by President Gerald R. Ford to oversee the civilian use of nuclear materials in the United States.
Event.8:
Opening of the Second Vatican Council
The Second Vatican Council, announced by Pope John XXIII in 1959, opened this day in 1962, lasted for three years, and remains a symbol (controversial to some) of the church's readiness to adapt to modern life.
Event.9: Second Vatican Council (21st ecumenical) convened by Pope John XXIII
Event.10:
Steve Young
American football player
was born
Event.11: The unmanned U.S. deep-space probe Pioneer 1 was launched into lunar orbit.
Event.12:
Dawn French
Welsh actress
was born
Event.13: Philippine president Corazon Aquino (21) weds Tarlac governor Benigno Aquino Jr (22) in Pasay City, Philippines
Event.14: Fellow students Fidel Castro and Mirta Diaz-Balart marry (divorced 1955)
Event.15: Chinese civil war begins between Kuomintang government led by Chiang Kai-shek and Mao Zedong's Communist Party
Event.16:
Amitabh Bachchan
Indian actor
was born
Event.17: Actor Jackie Coogan (24) divorces actress Betty Grable (22) after 2 years of marriage
Event.18: Jazz musician Louis Armstrong (37) weds longtime girlfriend Alpha Smith
Event.19:
Sir Bobby Charlton
British athlete
was born
Event.20:
Elmore Leonard
American author
was born
Event.21: The South African (Boer) War began between Great Britain and the two Boer (Afrikaner) republics—the South African Republic (Transvaal) and the Orange Free State.
Event.22: The Daughters of the American Revolution (DAR) was organized.
Event.23: Battle of Camperdown (Kamperduin): British navy defeats Dutch fleet
Event.24: Earthquake kills 300,000 and destroys half of Calcutta, India
Event.25: Burchardi flood - "the second Grote Mandrenke" kills about 15,000 in North Friesland, Denmark and Germany
Event.26: Protestant troops under Jörg Göldli were defeated by Roman Catholic troops at the Battle of Kappel during the Swiss Reformation.
Event.27: Earthquake in Aleppo, Syria, kills an estimated 230,000
